<line: 4> Sheet 1

[TITLE]
<line: 6> UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
<line: 7> Eastern District of Pennsylvania.

[TITLE]
<line: 9> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE

[TITLE]
<line: 11> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]
<line: 13> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[TEXT]
<line: 15> Title & Section
<line: 16> Nature of Offense
<line: 17> 18 U.S.C. $ 924(a)(1)(A)
<line: 18> False statements to a federal firearms licensee.

[ABANDON]
<line: 20> Offense Ended
<line: 21> 8/28/2007

[ABANDON]
<line: 23> Count
<line: 24> 1

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through
<line: 27> 7
<line: 28> of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to
<line: 29> the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984..

[TEXT]
<line: 31>  The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)

[TEXT]
<line: 33> X Count(s)2

[TEXT]
<line: 35> X is
<line: 36>  aredismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 38> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence,
<line: 39> or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay restitution,
<line: 40> the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

[TEXT]
<line: 42> March 25, 2011
<line: 43> Date of Imposition of Judgment.

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 46> Lawrence F. Stengel, United States District Judge.
<line: 47> Name and Title of Judge
<line: 48> Dat

[TITLE]
<line: 13> IMPRISONMENT
<line: 14> Marshal
<line: 15> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a
<line: 16> total term of:

[TEXT]
<line: 18> ONE (1) DAY

[TEXT]
<line: 20> The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:.

[TEXT]
<line: 22> The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal..

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:.

[ABANDON]
<line: 26>  a.m.

[TEXT]
<line: 28>   as notified by the United States Marshal.

[TEXT]
<line: 30>  The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:.

[TEXT]
<line: 32>  before 2 p.m. on
<line: 33> as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 34>  as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office..

[TEXT]
<line: 38> I have executed this judgment as follows:

[ABANDON]

<line: 3> (Rev. 09/08) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 4> Sheet 3 - Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment-Page
<line: 7> 3
<line: 8> of

[TITLE]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT:
<line: 11> JUREL DANIEL
<line: 12> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 13> DPAE5:10CR000173-001

[TITLE]
<line: 15> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of :.

[TEXT]
<line: 19> THREE (3) YEARS

[TEXT]
<line: 21>  The defendant must report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant is released within 72 hours of release from the
<line: 22> custody of the Bureau of Prisons.

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant shall not commit another federal, state or local crime..

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled
<line: 27> substance. The defendant shall submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests
<line: 28> thereafter, as determined by the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 30> The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that the defendant poses a low risk of
<line: 31> future substance abuse. (Check. if applicable.)
<line: 32> X
<line: 33> The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. (Check, ifapplicable.)
<line: 34> X
<line: 35> The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (Check. if applicable.)
<line: 36> The defendant shall comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.  16901, et seq.)
<line: 37> as directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons, or any state sex offender registration agency in which he or she resides,
<line: 38> works, is a student, or was convicted of a qualifying offense. (Check, if applicable.).

[TEXT]
<line: 40> The defendant shall participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (Check, ifapplicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 42> If this judgment imposes a fine or restitution, it is a condition of supervised release that the defendant pay in accordance with the
<line: 43> Schedule of Payments sheet of this judgment.

[TEXT]
<line: 45> The defendant must comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court as well as with any additional conditions
<line: 46> on the attached page.

[TITLE]
<line: 48> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 50> 1)
<line: 51> the defendant shall not leave the judicial district without the permission of the court or probation officer;
<line: 52> 2)
<line: 53>  the defendant shall report to the probation officer and shall submit a truthful and complete written report within the first five days of
<line: 54> each month;
<line: 55> 3
<line: 56>  the defendant shall answer truthfully all inquiries by the probation officer and follow the instructions of the probation officer;
<line: 57> 4)
<line: 58> the defendant shall support his or her dependents and meet other family responsibilities;.
<line: 59> 5)
<line: 60> the defendant shall work regularly at a lawful occupation, unless excused by the probation officer for schooling, training, or other
<line: 61> acceptable reasons;
<line: 62> 6)
<line: 63>  the defendant shall notify the probation officer at least ten days prior to any change in residence or employment;
<line: 64> 7)
<line: 65>  the defendant shall refrain from excessive use of alcohol and shall not purchase, possess, use, distribute, or administer any
<line: 66> controlled substance or any paraphernalia related to any controlled substances, except as prescribed by a physician;
<line: 67> 8)
<line: 68> the defendant shall not frequent places where controlled substances are illegally sold, used, distributed, or administered;
<line: 69> 9)
<line: 70> the defendant shall not associate with any persons engaged in criminal activity and shall not associate with any person convicted of a
<line: 71> felony, unless granted permission to do so'by the probation officer,
<line: 72> 10)
<line: 73> the defendant shall permit a probation officer to visit him or her at any time at home or elsewhere and shall permit confiscation of any
<line: 74> contraband observed in plain view of the probation officer;.
<line: 75> 11)
<line: 76>  the defendant shall notify the probation officer within seventy-two hours of being arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer;
<line: 77> 12)
<line: 78> the defendant shall not enter into any agreement to act as an informer or a special agent of a law enforcement agency without the
<line: 79> permission of the court; and
<line: 80> 13)
<line: 81>  as directed by the probation officer, the defendant shall notify third parties of risks that may be occasioned by the defendant's criminal
<line: 82> record or personal history or characteristics and shall permit the probation officer to make such notifications and to confirm the
<line: 83> defendant's compliance with such notification requirement.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> AO 245B
<line: 3> (Rev. 09/08) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 4> Sheet 3A  Supervised Release

[TEXT]
<line: 6> DEFENDANT:
<line: 7> JUREL DANIEL
<line: 8> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 9> DPAE5: 10CR000173-001

[TITLE]
<line: 11> ADDITIONAL SUPERVISED RELEASE TERMS

[TEXT]
<line: 13> The defendant is to be confined to his residence for the first nine (9) months of his term of supervised release. The defendant
<line: 14> shall be required to be at his residence at all times except for approved absences for gainfu! employment, community service,
<line: 15> religious services, medical care, educational or training programs, and at other such times as may be specifically authorized
<line: 16> by the United States Probation Office. The defendant shall wear an electronic monitoring device and follow electronic
<line: 17> monitoring procedures. The defendant shall permit the probation officer access to the residence at all times and maintain a
<line: 18> telephone at the residence without any custom services or portable, cordless equipment. The defendant shall comply with
<line: 19> any other specific conditions of home confinement as the probation officer requires. The defendant shall pay the costs of
<line: 20> electronic monitoring.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> AO 245B
<line: 3> (Rev. 09/08) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 4> Sheet 3C --- Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment-Page
<line: 7> 5
<line: 8> of

[TEXT]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT:
<line: 11> JUREL DANIEL
<line: 12> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 13> DPAE5:10CR000173-001

[TITLE]
<line: 15> SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant shall provide the United States Probation Office with full disclosure of his financial records to include yearly
<line: 18>  income tax returns upon the request of the United States Probation Office. The defendant shall cooperate with the probation.
<line: 19> officer in the investigation of his financial dealings and shall provide truthful monthly statements of his income..

[TEXT]
<line: 21> The defendant is prohibited from incurring any new credit charges or opening additional lines of credit without the approval.
<line: 22> of the probation officer, unless the defendant is in compliance with a payment schedule for any fine obligation. The.
<line: 23> defendant shall not encumber or liquidate interest in any assets unless it is in direct service of the fine obligation or otherwise
<line: 24> has the express approval of the Court.

[ABANDON]

[TITLE]
<line: 16> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 18> The defendant must pay the total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on Sheet 6..

[TEXT]
<line: 20> Restitution
<line: 21> $ N/A

[ISOLATE_FORMULA]
<line: 23> Fine
<line: 24> $ 0

[TEXT]
<line: 26> TOTALS
<line: 27> $ 100.00

[TEXT]
<line: 29>  The determination of restitution is deferred until
<line: 30> . An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (A0 24sc) will be entered.
<line: 31> after such determination..

[TEXT]
<line: 33>  The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below.n.

[TEXT]
<line: 35> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in
<line: 36> the priority order or percentage payment column below. However, pursuant to 18 U.s.C.  3664(i), all nonfederal victims must be paid
<line: 37> before the' United States is paid..

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> Restitution Ordered.

[TEXT]
<line: 41> Total Loss*

[TITLE]
<line: 43> Name of Payee

[ABANDON]
<line: 45> Priority or Percentage

[ABANDON]

[ABANDON]
<line: 48> TOTALS

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 51>  Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement $

[TEXT]
<line: 53> The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before the
<line: 54> fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. $ 3612(f). All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be subject
<line: 55> to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(g)..

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 58> The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:

[TEXT]
<line: 60>  the interest requirement is waived for the
<line: 61>  fine  restitution.
<line: 62>  the interest requirement for the
<line: 63> fine
<line: 64>   restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 66> * Findings for the total amount of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or after.
<line: 67> September 13, 1994, but before April 23, 1996.

[TITLE]
<line: 16> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 18> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties is due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 20> A
<line: 21> X Lump sum payment of$
<line: 22> 100.00
<line: 23> due immediately, balance due
<line: 24> not later than
<line: 25> , or
<line: 26> in accordance
<line: 27>  c,
<line: 28>  D,
<line: 29> 0
<line: 30> E, or
<line: 31>  F below; or
<line: 32> B
<line: 33>  Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 34> c,
<line: 35>  D, or
<line: 36>  F below); or
<line: 37> C
<line: 38> 0
<line: 39> Payment in equal
<line: 40> (e.g., weekly, monthly. quarterly) installments of $
<line: 41> over a period of
<line: 42> (e.g.., months or years), to commence
<line: 43> (e.g.. 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; or
<line: 44> D
<line: 45> 0
<line: 46> Payment in equal
<line: 47> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 48> over a period of
<line: 49> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 50> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 51> term of supervision; or
<line: 52> E
<line: 53> 0
<line: 54>  Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within
<line: 55> (e.g.. 30 or 60 days) after release from
<line: 56> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time; or.
<line: 57> F
<line: 58>  Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:

[TEXT]
<line: 60> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due
<line: 61> during imprisonment. All criminal monetary penalties, except those payments made through the Federal Bureau of Prisons' Inmate.
<line: 62> Financial Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 64> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[TEXT]
<line: 66> Joint and Several

[TEXT]
<line: 68> Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,.
<line: 69> and corresponding payee, if appropriate.

[TEXT]
<line: 71> 0
<line: 72> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution.
<line: 73> 0
<line: 74> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):
<line: 75> X
<line: 76> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:
<line: 77> A Ruger, Model p95, 9mm caliber pistol, serial number 316-40462 and a Taurus, Model PT945, .45 caliber pistol, serial number
<line: 78> NOE83674.

[TEXT]
<line: 80> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal,.
<line: 81> (5) fine interest, (6)'community restitution, (7) penalties, and (8) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
